meanings.definition: A tropical fruit with a green or black skin and a large seed inside.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy eating aguacate in my salad.
meanings.sent2: The aguacate was ripe and ready to be mashed into guacamole.
meanings.sent3: The aguacate rolled off the table and surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her love for aguacate was as deep as the seed inside.
meanings.sent5: The creamy texture of the aguacate made it a perfect addition to the dish.

meanings.definition: The tree that produces the aguacate fruit.
meanings.sent1: The aguacate tree in our backyard provides shade during hot days.
meanings.sent2: Many aguacate trees were planted in the orchard for a fruitful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The aguacate tree waved its branches in the wind, as if saying hello.
meanings.sent4: The aguacate tree stood tall and proud, bearing delicious fruits for all.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the aguacate tree rustled softly in the breeze, creating a calming sound.
